Name: Upper part of a bearded male pottery figure
Description: Upper part of a male figurine in archaic Greek style, showing a man with pointed beard, wearing a cloak, and with right hand held to the breast, from the city of Naukratis in the Western Delta. The city was a unique Greek colony installed with the permission of the Egyptian kings in the 26th Dynasty, to channel the trade between the Nile valley and the Aegean.
